importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: This is the date when the article was updated, indicating the most current information on Biden's treatment status.
Biden's personal office confirmed the diagnosis of aggressive prostate cancer that had spread to his bones in May 2025, which is a critical milestone in understanding the progression of his illness.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: This time frame covers the key period from the initial diagnosis to the completion of radiation therapy, showing the timeline of treatment and public response.

keyTakeAways: Former President Joe Biden has completed a course of radiation therapy as part of his treatment for prostate cancer.
Biden was diagnosed with an aggressive form of prostate cancer that had spread to his bones earlier in the year.
He began a pill regimen earlier this year and underwent Mohs surgery for skin cancer, indicating a multi-faceted approach to his health.
Biden's daughter Ashley posted a video and photo celebrating the completion of radiation therapy, highlighting public attention and personal resilience.
The treatment was carried out at Penn Medicine Radiation Oncology in Philadelphia, a major medical institution known for advanced oncology care.
The former president remains active in public life, with upcoming speaking engagements, demonstrating his resilience and commitment to public service despite his illness.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Former President Joe Biden has completed a course of radiation therapy as part of his treatment for an aggressive form of prostate cancer that had spread to his bones. The treatment took place at Penn Medicine Radiation Oncology in Philadelphia, and was publicly celebrated by his daughter Ashley, who shared a video and photo of the moment. Biden, who began a pill regimen earlier in the year and underwent Mohs surgery for skin cancer, remains committed to public service, with upcoming appearances including a speech at the Edward M. Kennedy Institute and an event for the Nebraska Democratic Party. While future treatment steps are not yet clear, Biden has expressed optimism about overcoming the illness, emphasizing that the cancer had not penetrated major organs.
title: Biden completes a course of radiation therapy for cancer treatment
